issue.title: Bug: compiler fails to issue error/warning when undefined label string is referenced by Equation
issue.body:
The compiler currently fails to issue any kind of warning if an undefined label string by an `Equation` or `Text` shape.  Curiously, the program fails to compile when the undefined label is referenced from `Equation`, but will still compile when referenced from `Text`.

The failure to compile and lack of warning is particularly hard to debug in Style programs with many rules.

Here's a complete example:

**domain**
```
type Point
```

**style**
```
canvas {
    width = 240
    height = 200
}

forall Point p { -- NOTE: no condition "has label"
    p.icon = Circle {
        r: 4
        fillColor: #000
    }

    p.labelText = Equation {
        string: p.label
        center: p.icon.center + (0,14)
    }
}
```

**substance**
```
Point p
-- Label p $p_0$ -- works if this line is uncommented; otherwise, fails to compile but doesn't report an error
```

comment.body:
Now an error is thrown for the example, but it's not great:

https://penrose.cs.cmu.edu/try/?gist=be5e4b8fb1c1c31b06d4c52df8b06ed3

```
FATAL: Label 'string' and 'fontSize' must be non-empty and non-optimized for `p`.labelText
```

issue.title: Label gathering code throws exceptions in `core`
issue.body: Currently the label collection code returns okay errors but the call site (`prepareState`) throws them as an exception. Instead, we should change the return type of `prepareState` to be `Result<State, PenroseError>` and pass down the errors properly.

issue.title: Label gathering code throws exceptions in `core`
issue.body: Currently the label collection code returns okay errors but the call site (`prepareState`) throws them as an exception. Instead, we should change the return type of `prepareState` to be `Result<State, PenroseError>` and pass down the errors properly.

comment.body: Closing because `v3.0.0` fixed this by removing `prepareState` and calling `collectLabels` correctly in the new `compile` function.

issue.title: fix: duplicate `<penrose>` tags in exported SVGs
issue.body:
# Description

Resolves #1586.

# Implementation strategy and design decisions

The cause is an extra `svg.appendChild(metadata)` call at the end of the `SVGAddCode` function introduced in https://github.com/penrose/penrose/pull/1171. This line should only be executed when there isn't already a `<penrose>` node.

comment.body:
## Deploying with    Cloudflare Pages
Latest commit: 67e7466
Status:🚫  Build failed.
[View logs](https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/pages/view/penrose/35a3256f-fe28-4d78-b759-9173e70463be)

issue.title: bug: two <penrose> tags in Penrose-exported SVGs
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Here is the SVG code of a Penrose-exported diagram:

![image](https://github.com/penrose/penrose/assets/16521252/6cbc52af-ba42-42d1-b041-71060f92e906)


As seen, the code contains two `<penrose>` blocks. The first one only contains the cropped view box. The second one contains the same cropped view box, as well as the source code information.

comment.body:
> Oh that's not great haha; how hard is this to fix?

It's a one-liner :P

issue.title: fix: duplicate `<penrose>` tags in exported SVGs
issue.body:
# Description

Resolves #1586.

# Implementation strategy and design decisions

The cause is an extra `svg.appendChild(metadata)` call at the end of the `SVGAddCode` function introduced in https://github.com/penrose/penrose/pull/1171. This line should only be executed when there isn't already a `<penrose>` node.

comment.body:
# ± [Registry diff](https://github.com/penrose/penrose/commit/d22bd0e4c19a59128d47421bc73336e124de6b54)

```
```

# 📊 [Performance](https://github.com/penrose/penrose/actions/runs/6656122796)

## Key

Note that each bar component rounds up to the nearest 100ms, so each full bar is an overestimate by up to 400ms.

```
     0s   1s   2s   3s   4s   5s   6s
     |    |    |    |    |    |    |
name ▝▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▚▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▞▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▘
      compiling optimizing rendering
```

If a row has only one bar instead of four, that means it's not a trio and the bar just shows the total time spent for that example, again rounded up to the nearest 100ms.

payload.description: Create beautiful diagrams just by typing notation in plain text.

pull_request.title: fix: duplicate `<penrose>` tags in exported SVGs
pull_request.body:
# Description

Resolves #1586.

# Implementation strategy and design decisions

The cause is an extra `svg.appendChild(metadata)` call at the end of the `SVGAddCode` function introduced in https://github.com/penrose/penrose/pull/1171. This line should only be executed when there isn't already a `<penrose>` node.

repo.name: penrose
repo.description: Create beautiful diagrams just by typing notation in plain text.

issue.title: Cannot share gists with empty programs in the IDE
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

When sharing a trio in the IDE, clicking "share" returns "Validation failed" if any of the source files are empty.

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Start the IDE with empty programs and make sure you're logged in
2. Click on "share"
3. See "Validation Failed" toast
